hints.content:
**Area** is the space a flat shape fills.

To measure area, we can count the number of **same-sized** square units needed to cover a shape. The squares should have **no gaps or overlaps**.

![A square.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/af46131ca093f4eec39e439a5be61421fe4f1048) is $1$ **square unit** because it measures $1$ unit on each side.

This shape has $8$ square units covering it, but there are gaps:

![A rectangle made up of two rows with equal-sized squares. The top row has four squares and four missing rectangles. The bottom row has four squares and four missing rectangles.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/d8c21f291edc05e66f27bb64b4883a98ee157a8c)

This shape has $8$ square units covering it, but there are gaps and overlaps:

![A square made up of three rows of equal-sized squares. The top and bottom rows have two squares each with one missing square. in each row. The second row has no squares. There is a square made up of 2 rows with 2 squares in each row that is centered in and overlaps the three rows of the larger square.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/0c6cd3aa7934d8c6fdeec0a6f148077ba8f66042)

This shape has $8$ square units covering it. There are no gaps or overlaps.

![2 rows of equal-sized squares connected together. The first rows 2 squares. The second row has 6 squares.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/fe93d2df1869d5f771820c89baf25a8498b1bebe) 

So, this shape has an area of $8$ square units.

This shape has $8$ square units covering it. There are no gaps or overlaps.

![Four rows of equal-sized squares connected together. The top row has one square. The second and third row have three squares each. The fourth row has one square.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/d2d1a74125c9e7fbfb8f5a00c87aaaa75fe35a5a)

So, this shape has an area of $8$ square units.

These shapes have an area of $8$ square units:  
![2 rows of equal-sized squares connected together. The first rows 2 squares. The second row has 6 squares.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/fe93d2df1869d5f771820c89baf25a8498b1bebe) ![Four rows of equal-sized squares connected together. The top row has one square. The second and third row have three squares each. The fourth row has one square.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/d2d1a74125c9e7fbfb8f5a00c87aaaa75fe35a5a)

question.content:
**Which shapes have an area of $8$ square units?**

![A square.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/af46131ca093f4eec39e439a5be61421fe4f1048) is $1$ square unit.

choices.content: ![Two rows of equal-sized squares connected together. The first row has two squares. The second row has six squares.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/fe93d2df1869d5f771820c89baf25a8498b1bebe)

![A rectangle made up of two rows with equal-sized squares. The top row has four squares and four missing rectangles. The bottom row has four squares and four missing rectangles.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/d8c21f291edc05e66f27bb64b4883a98ee157a8c)

![Four rows of equal-sized squares connected together. The top row has one square. The second and third row have three squares each. The fourth row has one square.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/d2d1a74125c9e7fbfb8f5a00c87aaaa75fe35a5a)

![A square made up of three rows of equal-sized squares. The top and bottom rows have two squares each with one missing square. in each row. The second row has no squares. There is a square made up of 2 rows of equal-sized squares with 2 squares in each row that is centered in and overlaps the three rows of the larger square.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/0c6cd3aa7934d8c6fdeec0a6f148077ba8f66042)
